page.title: Health (Regulation of Termination of Pregnancy) Bill 2018

revision.text:
Health standards have greatly improved throughout the Bahamas in recent years. New hospitals and healthcare facilities have opened in [[Nassau, Bahamas|Nassau]] and [[Grand Bahama]].
There are high levels of health and economic inequality and most of the population are unable to obtain private health insurance. Catastrophic spending on healthcare has bankrupted many patients and their families.
==Diseases== Vaccination against diseases such as measles and diphtheria has lowered the infection and death rate among children. The infection rate of HIV/AIDS is quite high — in 2013, an estimated 500 people died from AIDS in the Bahamas.<ref>{{cite news |title=Healthcare in the Bahamas |url=https://www.internations.org/bahamas-expats/guide/living-in-the-bahamas-15742/healthcare-in-the-bahamas-2 |accessdate=15 November 2018 |publisher=InterNations |date=2018}}</ref>
Rates of [[non-communicable disease]]s have risen to the point where treatment costs challenge the viability of the healthcare system.
==Healthcare== Free care is only provided to legal residents. The National Health Insurance program was established in 2017. 42,000 Bahamians, about 10% of the population, have enrolled. Membership is voluntary. The [[Out Islands]] are serviced by small government clinics.<ref>{{cite news |title=Health |url=https://www.lonelyplanet.com/the-bahamas/health |accessdate=15 November 2018 |publisher=Lonely Planet |date=2018}}</ref> There are 80 primary care providers, including 4 private labs which provides care across [[New Providence]], [[Grand Bahama]], [[Abaco Islands|Abaco]] and [[Exuma]].
About 8% of GDP is spent on healthcare in 2018. The Bahamas is one of the least efficient nations in the world when it comes to value-based care, according to the [[National Health Insurance Authority]].<ref>{{cite news |title=National Health Insurance A Shared Responsibility |url=http://www.nhibahamas.gov.bs/wp-content/uploads/20181019-Policy-Paper-Bahamas-Public-Consultation-Final.pdf |accessdate=15 November 2018 |publisher=NHI Bahamas |date=2018}}</ref>
A tax on wages to fund National Health Insurance was proposed in 2018.<ref>{{cite news |title=NHI consultation period with stakeholders extended |url=https://ewnews.com/nhi-consultation-period-with-stakeholders-extended |accessdate=15 November 2018 |publisher=EyeWiness News |date=15 November 2018}}</ref>
==See also== [[List of hospitals in Bahamas]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Health in the Bahamas| ]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6)
revision.text:
[[File:MUST Hospital.JPG|thumb|[[Macau University of Science and Technology Hospital]]]]
Macau has a universally accessible single-payer system funded by taxes collected by the government from corporations and residents.
Macau is served by one major public hospital, the [[Hospital Conde S. Januário]], and one major private hospital, the [[Kiang Wu Hospital]], both located in [[Macau Peninsula]], as well as a university associated hospital called [[Macau University of Science and Technology Hospital]] in [[Cotai]]. Currently none of the Macau hospitals have [[international healthcare accreditation]].
In addition to hospitals, Macau also has numerous health centres providing free basic medical care to residents. Consultation in [[traditional Chinese medicine]] is also available.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gcs.gov.mo/files/spage/CFA10_E.html|title=Macau Factsheet|accessdate=2007-11-13|publisher=The Govt. of Macau SAR}}</ref> Currently none of the Macau hospitals is independently assessed through [[international healthcare accreditation]]. There are no western-style medical schools in Macau and thus all aspiring physicians in Macau have to obtain their education and qualification elsewhere (such as at the [[University of Hong Kong]] or [[Chinese University of Hong Kong]]).<ref>Macau Yearbook 2007</ref> Local nurses are trained at the [[Macau Polytechnic Institute]] and the [[Kiang Wu Nursing College of Macau]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ipm.edu.mo/ess/|title=Macau Polytechnic Institute General Information|accessdate=2007-12-03|publisher=Macau Polytechnic Institute}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kwnc.edu.mo/web/cmain.htm|title=Homepage of the College of Nursing and Midwifery|accessdate=2007-11-13|publisher=College of Nursing and Midwifery, Macau}}</ref> Currently there are no training courses in [[midwifery]] in Macau.
The Health Bureau in Macau is mainly responsible for coordinating the activities between the public and private organisations in the area of [[public health]], and assure the health of citizens through specialised and [[primary health care]] services, as well as disease prevention and [[health promotion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ssm.gov.mo/design/introduction/e_introduce_fs.htm|title=The introduction of Health Bureau, Macau SAR|accessdate=2007-11-13|publisher=The Govt. of Macau SAR|language=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070912141127/http://www.ssm.gov.mo/design/introduction/e_introduce_fs.htm|archivedate=2007-09-12|df=}}</ref> The Centre for Disease Control and Prevention was established in 2001, which monitors the operation of hospitals, health centres, and the [[blood transfusion]] centre in Macau. It also handles the organisation of care and prevention of diseases affecting the population, sets guidelines for hospitals and private health care providers, and issues [[medical license|licences]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ssm.gov.mo/design/organization/e_legis_fs.htm|title=The policy and functions of the department of health, Macau SAR|accessdate=2007-11-13|publisher=The Govt. of Macau SAR|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070912140926/http://www.ssm.gov.mo/design/organization/e_legis_fs.htm|archivedate=2007-09-12|df=}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Areia Preta Health Center]] * [[Macau]] * [[List of hospitals in Macau]]
==Notes== {{reflist|2}}
==References== *{{cite book | author = Government Information Bureau |year=2007 |title=Macau Yearbook 2007 |publisher=Government Information Bureau of the Macau SAR |isbn=978-99937-56-09-5 }} {{Asia topic|Health in}}
[[Category:Health in Macau| ]]

{{Refimprove|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox medical condition (new) | name = Idiosyncratic drug reaction | image = | caption = | | pronounce = | field = | synonyms = | symptoms = | complications = | onset = | duration = | types = | causes = | risks = | diagnosis = | differential = | prevention = | treatment = | medication = | prognosis = | frequency = | deaths = }} '''Idiosyncratic drug reactions''', also known as '''type B reactions''', are [[Adverse drug reaction|drug reactions]] that occur rarely and unpredictably amongst the population. This is not to be mistaken with [[idiopathic]], which implies that the cause is not known. They frequently occur with exposure to new drugs, as they have not been fully tested and the full range of possible side-effects have not been discovered; they may also be listed as an [[adverse drug reaction]] with a drug, but are extremely rare. Some patients have multiple-[[drug intolerance]]. Patients who have multiple idiopathic effects that are nonspecific are more likely to have anxiety and depression.<ref name="pmid12622606">{{cite journal |vauthors=Davies SJ, Jackson PR, Ramsay LE, Ghahramani P |title=Drug intolerance due to nonspecific adverse effects related to psychiatric morbidity in hypertensive patients |journal=Arch. Intern. Med. |volume=163 |issue=5 |pages=592–600 |year=2003 |pmid=12622606 |doi=10.1001/archinte.163.5.592}}</ref>Idiosyncratic drug reactions appear to not be concentration dependent. A minimal amount of drug will cause an immune response, but it is suspected that at a low enough concentration, a drug will be less likely to initiate an [[immune response]].
== Mechanism == In adverse drug reactions involving overdoses, the toxic effect is simply an extension of the pharmacological effect (Type A adverse drug reactions). On the other hand, clinical symptoms of idiosyncratic drug reactions (Type B adverse drug reactions) are different from the pharmacological effect of the drug.
The proposed mechanism of most idiosyncratic drug reactions is immune-mediated toxicity. To create an immune response, a foreign molecule must be present that antibodies can bind to (i.e. the antigen) and cellular damage must exist. Very often, drugs will not be immunogenic because they are too small to induce immune response. However, a drug can cause an immune response if the drug binds a larger molecule. Some unaltered drugs, such as [[penicillin]], will bind avidly to proteins. Others must be bioactivated into a toxic compound that will in turn bind to proteins. The second criterion of cellular damage can come either from a toxic drug/drug metabolite, or from an injury or infection. These will sensitize the immune system to the drug and cause a response. Idiosyncratic reactions fall conventionally under toxicology.
==See also== *[[Idiosyncrasy]]
==References== {{reflist}} == External links == {{Medical resources | DiseasesDB = | ICD10 = {{ICD10|T|78|4|t|66}} | ICD9 = {{ICD9|995.3}} | ICDO = | OMIM = | MedlinePlus = | eMedicineSubj = | eMedicineTopic = | MeshID = }} [[Category:Medical terminology]] [[Category:Pharmacy]] [[Category:Clinical pharmacology]]

revision.comment: /* Key changes */[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], replaced: and and → and using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
The '''Ionising Radiations Regulations''' ('''IRR''') are [[statutory instrument]]s which form the main legal requirements for the use and control of [[ionizing radiation|ionising radiation]] in the [[United Kingdom]]. There have been several versions of the regulations, the current legislation was introduced in 2017 (IRR17), repealing the 1999 regulations and implementing the 2013/59/Euratom [[European Union directive]].<ref name="2017 COP">{{cite book |title=Work with ionising radiation Ionising Radiations Regulations 2017 Approved Code of Practice and guidance |date=2018 |publisher=[[Health and Safety Executive]] |isbn=978 0 7176 6662 1 |edition=2nd |url=http://www.hse.gov.uk/pUbns/priced/l121.pdf}}</ref>
The main aim of the regulations as defined by the 1999 official code of practice was to "establish a framework for ensuring that exposure to ionising radiation arising from work activities, whether man made or natural radiation and from external radiation or internal radiation, is kept [[ALARP|as low as reasonably practicable]] (ALARP) and does not exceed dose limits specified for individuals".<ref name="COP intro page 6">{{cite book |title=Work with ionising radiation Ionising Radiations Regulations 1999 Approved Code of Practice and guidance |date=2000 |publisher=[[Health and Safety Executive]] |isbn=978 0 7176 1746 3 |edition=1st |url=http://www.hse.gov.uk/pUbns/priced/l121.pdf |archiveurl=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20100409190759/http://www.hse.gov.uk///pubns/priced/l121.pdf |archivedate=9 April 2010}}</ref>
==The 1999 regulations== {{Infobox UK legislation |short_title = The Ionising Radiations Regulations 1999 |type = Statutory Instrument |parliament = United Kingdom Parliament |year = |citation = 1999 No. 3232 |introduced_by = [[Larry Whitty]] – [[Department of the Environment, Transport and the Regions]] |territorial_extent = United Kingdom, overseas<ref>[[Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974]], s.84; reg.12</ref> |si_made_date = 3 December 1999 |si_laid_date = |commencement = 1 January 2000 |repeal_date = 1 January 2018 |replaces = Ionising Radiations Regulations 1985 |amends = |primary_legislation = [[European Communities Act 1972 (UK)|European Communities Act 1972]], [[Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974]] |eu_directives = |amendments = — |related_legislation = — |repealing_legislation= Ionising Radiations Regulations 2017 |status = Repealed |original_text = http://www.opsi.gov.uk/si/si1999/19993232.htm |legislation_history = |use_new_UK-LEG = no |revised_text = }} ===Background=== [[File:International policy system radiological protection.png|thumb|400px|International policy relationships in radiological protection]]
The regulations came into force on 1 January 2000, replacing the 'Ionising Radiations Regulations 1985'. They effectively implement the majority of the European Basic Safety Standards Directive '96/29/Euratom' under the auspices of the [[Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974]].<ref name="COP intro page 6" /> This [[Directive (European Union)|European Directive]] is in turn a reflection of the recommendations of the [[International Commission on Radiological Protection]].<ref>[http://ec.europa.eu/energy/nuclear/radioprotection/doc/legislation/9629_en.pdf The Council of the European Union | Council directive 96/29/Euratom laying down the basic safety standards for the protection of the health of workers and the general public against the dangers arising from ionising radiation] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101123022701/http://ec.europa.eu/energy/nuclear/radioprotection/doc/legislation/9629_en.pdf |date=2010-11-23 }}</ref>
The regulations are aimed at employers and are enforced by the [[Health and Safety Executive]](HSE). They form the legal basis for ionising radiation protection in the United Kingdom (UK), although work with ionising radiation is also controlled in the UK through other statutory instruments such as the Nuclear Installations Act 1965 and the [[Radioactive Substances Act 1993]].<ref name="COP intro page 6" />
The IRR99 make legal requirements including prior authorisation of the use of [[particle accelerators]] and [[x-ray]] machines, the appointment of ''radiation protection supervisors (RPS) and advisers (RPA)'', control and restriction of exposure to ionising radiation (including dose limits), and a requirement for local rules. Local rules including the designation of ''controlled areas'', defined as places where "special procedures are needed to restrict significant exposure".
In 2013 the [[European Union]] adopted directive 2013/59/Euratom which requires updated Ionising Radiations Regulations to implement the directive in UK law by 2018.<ref>{{cite web|title=Directive 2013/59/Euratom - protection against ionising radiation|url=https://osha.europa.eu/en/legislation/directives/directive-2013-59-euratom-protection-against-ionising-radiation|website=European Agency for Safety and Health at Work|accessdate=13 January 2017}}</ref> Changes include reduced eye dose limits as a result of updated ICRP recommendations.<ref>{{cite web|title=Revision of Radiation Protection directives including Basic Safety Standards (BSS) and Outside Workers directives|url=http://www.hse.gov.uk/aboutus/europe/euronews/dossiers/radiationprotect.htm|website=Health and Safety Executive|accessdate=13 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Statement on Tissue Reactions|url=http://www.icrp.org/page.asp?id=123|website=ICRP|accessdate=13 January 2017|date=2011}}</ref>
===Ionising and non-ionising radiation and associated health risks=== The regulations impose duties on employers to protect employees and anyone else from radiation arising from work with radioactive substances and other forms of ionising radiation.<ref name="explanatory note" /> In the United Kingdom the [[Health and Safety Executive]] is one of a number of public bodies which regulates workplaces which could expose workers to radiation.<ref>[http://www.hse.gov.uk/radiation/index.htm HSE | Radiation]</ref>
Radiation itself is energy that travels either as electromagnetic waves, or as subatomic particles and can be categorised as either 'ionising' or 'non-ionising radiation'.<ref>Devereux, T. 'Health and safety for managers, supervisors and safety representatives', Chartered Institute of Environmental Health, 2008 p. 240 {{ISBN|978-1-904306-84-9}}</ref>
[[Ionising radiation]] occurs naturally but can also be artificially created. Generally people can be exposed to radiation externally from radioactive material or internally by inhaling or ingesting radioactive substances.<ref name="hse ionising radiation">[http://www.hse.gov.uk/radiation/ionising/ HSE | Ionising radiation]</ref> Exposure to electromagnetic rays such as x-rays and gamma rays can, depending on the time exposed, cause sterility, genetic defects, premature ageing and death.<ref>[http://www.nih.gov/health/chip/od/radiation/#xfive National Institute of Health | What are the adverse effects of Ionising radiation]</ref>
[[Non-ionising radiation]] is the terms used to describe the part of the electromagnetic spectrum covering 'Optical radiation', such as ultraviolet light and 'electromagnetic fields' such as microwaves and radio frequencies.<ref>[http://www.hse.gov.uk/radiation/nonionising/index.htm HSE | Non Ionising radiation]</ref> Health risks caused by exposure to this type of radiation will often be as a result of too much exposure to ultraviolet light either from the sun or from sunbeds which could lead to [[skin cancer]].<ref>[http://www.cancerhelp.org.uk/about-cancer/cancer-questions/radiation-microwaves-and-cancer#non Cancer help | Non Ionising radiation]</ref>
===Key areas of the regulations=== The regulations are split into seven parts containing 41 regulations.<ref name="explanatory note">[http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/1999/3232/note/made Legislation.gov.uk | The Ionising Radiation Regulations 1999 - explanatory note]</ref> under the following sections.
* Interpretation and General * General Principles and Procedures * Arrangements for The Management of Radiation Protection * Designated Areas * Classification and Monitoring of Persons * Arrangements for the Control of Radioactive Substances, Articles and Equipment * Duties of Employees and Miscellaneous
===Dose limits=== In addition to requiring that radiation employers ensure that doses are kept as low as reasonably practicable (ALARP) the IRR99 also defines dose limits for certain classes of person. Dose limits do not apply to people undergoing a medical exposure or to those acting as "comforters and carers" to such.
{| class="wikitable" border="1" |+ Annual Dose Limits ! Class of Person !! Annual Dose Limit [[sievert|millisieverts]] |- | Employees aged 18 or over || 20 |- | Trainees aged 16 to 18 || 6 |- | Any other person || 1 |}
==Changes in the 2017 regulations== {{Infobox UK legislation |short_title = The Ionising Radiations Regulations 2017 |type = Statutory Instrument |parliament = United Kingdom Parliament |year = |citation = 2017 No. 1075 |introduced_by = |territorial_extent = United Kingdom, overseas<ref>[[Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974]], s.84; reg.12</ref> |si_made_date = 27 November 2017 |si_laid_date = 30 November 2017 |commencement = 1 January 2018 |repeal_date = |replaces = Ionising Radiations Regulations 1999 |amends = |primary_legislation = [[European Communities Act 1972 (UK)|European Communities Act 1972]], [[Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974]] |eu_directives = Council Directive 2013/59/Euratom |amendments = Ionising Radiation (Medical Exposure) Regulations 2017 (IRMER17) |related_legislation = |repealing_legislation= |status = current |original_text = http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2017/1075/made |legislation_history = |use_new_UK-LEG = |revised_text = }}
===Key changes=== The main changes in the 2017 regulations are summarised in the approved code of practice.<ref name="2017 COP" /> These include: * Reduced eye dose limit * "Graded approach" to authorisation * Broader definition of outside worker * Requirement for procedures to estimate dose to the public * Changes to guidance on cooperation of employees and timescale for medical appeals
The introduction of the Ionising Radiation (Medical Exposure) Regulations 2017 (IRMER17, the legislation that governs medical exposures in the UK) amended IRR17 to remove the regulation concerning medical equipment. These requirements are now under IRMER17.<ref name="2017 COP" /><ref>{{cite web |title=Ionising Radiation (Medical Exposure) Regulations 2017: guidance |url=https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/ionising-radiation-medical-exposure-regulations-2017-guidance |website=GOV.UK |publisher=Department of Health and Social Care |accessdate=3 July 2018 |language=en |date=27 June 2018}}</ref>
===Dose limits=== The dose limit to the lens of the eye has been reduced based on [[ICRP]] recommendation,<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Clement |first1=C.H. |last2=Stewart |first2=F.A. |last3=Akleyev |first3=A.V. |last4=Hauer-Jensen |first4=M. |last5=Hendry |first5=J.H. |last6=Kleiman |first6=N.J. |last7=MacVittie |first7=T.J. |last8=Aleman |first8=B.M. |last9=Edgar |first9=A.B. |last10=Mabuchi |first10=K. |last11=Muirhead |first11=C.R. |last12=Shore |first12=R.E. |last13=Wallace |first13=W.H. |title=ICRP PUBLICATION 118: ICRP Statement on Tissue Reactions and Early and Late Effects of Radiation in Normal Tissues and Organs — Threshold Doses for Tissue Reactions in a Radiation Protection Context |journal=Annals of the ICRP |date=February 2012 |volume=41 |issue=1-2 |pages=1–322 |doi=10.1016/j.icrp.2012.02.001 |url=http://www.icrp.org/publication.asp?id=ICRP%20Publication%20118}}</ref> the new limits are now as follows {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! rowspan="2"|Class of Person !! colspan="4"|Annual Dose Limit ([[sievert|millisieverts]]) |- ![[Effective dose (radiation)|Effective dose]] !! Lens of the eye !! Extremities !! Skin (averaged over 1 cm<sup>2</sup>) |- | Employees and trainees aged 18 or over || 20 || 20 || 500 || 500 |- | Trainees aged 16 to 18 || 6 || 15 || 150 || 150 |- | Any other person || 1 || 15 || 50 || 50 |}
==References==
<references />
==See also== * [[Sievert]] - SI unit of radiation dose. This page is a useful introduction to the many different dose quantities * [[Radiation protection]]
==External links== *[http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/1999/3232/made The Ionising Radiations Regulations 1999] *[https://osha.europa.eu/en/legislation/directives/73 Directive 96/29/Euratom] - European Agency for Safety and Health at Work {{Radiation protection|state=uncollapsed}} [[Category:1999 in British law]] [[Category:Statutory Instruments of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Health and safety in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Radiation protection]]

{{for|the name|Juul}} {{Infobox company | name = JUUL Labs | logo = Juul logo.svg | caption = | image = Juul with pods (29395579877).jpg | image_caption = JUUL vaporizer with pods and charger | type = Private | traded_as = | predecessor = [[PAX Labs]] | foundation = {{Start date and age|July 2017}}{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/schools-parents-fight-a-juul-e-cigarette-epidemic-1522677246|title=Schools and Parents Fight a Juul E-Cigarette Epidemic|last=Chaker|first=Anne Marie|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|date=4 April 2018}} | founder = | location = | location_city = [[San Francisco, California]] | location_country = United States | key_people = Kevin Burns ([[CEO]]) | area_served = United States
Canada | industry = | products = [[Electronic cigarette]]s | revenue = $1.1 billion | revenue_year = 2018 | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = [[PAX Labs]] (2015-2017)
Independent (2017-present) | num_employees = 800{{cite news |last1=Yakowicz |first1=Will |title=Inside Juul: The Most Promising, and Controversial, Vape Company in America |url=https://www.inc.com/will-yakowicz/2018-private-titans-juul-labs-vaporizer-nicotine-electronic-cigarettes.html |accessdate=September 26, 2018 |work=Inc.com |date=September 24, 2018}} |num_employees_year = 2018 | homepage = {{URL|juul.com}} }} '''JUUL Labs''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|dʒ|uː|l}} {{respell|JOOL}}, like "jewel") is an [[electronic cigarette]] company which spun off from [[PAX Labs]] in 2017. It makes the '''JUUL''' e-cigarette, which was introduced by PAX Labs in 2015. JUUL is a type of e-cigarette that uses nicotine salts that exist in leaf-based tobacco for its key ingredient. The JUUL became the most popular e-cigarette in the United States at the end of 2017 and has a market share of 72% as of September 2018.{{cite journal |last1=King |first1=Brian A. |last2=Gammon |first2=Doris G. |last3=Marynak |first3=Kristy L. |last4=Rogers |first4=Todd |title=Electronic Cigarette Sales in the United States, 2013-2017 |journal=JAMA |date=October 2, 2018 |volume=320 |issue=13 |pages=1379 |doi=10.1001/jama.2018.10488}}{{cite news |last1=LaVito |first1=Angelica |title=Popular e-cigarette Juul's sales have surged almost 800 percent over the past year |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/07/02/juul-e-cigarette-sales-have-surged-over-the-past-year.html |accessdate=October 4, 2018 |work=CNBC |date=2 July 2018}} Its widespread use by youth has triggered multiple investigations by the [[U.S. Food and Drug Administration]]. == History == JUUL, the [[electronic cigarette]], was introduced by [[PAX Labs]] on June 1, 2015. In July 2017, JUUL was spun out of PAX Labs as an independent company. Tyler Goldman, former CEO of PAX Labs, was named CEO of JUUL after the spin-off. It was announced on December 11, 2017 that Goldman "intends to pursue new entrepreneurial opportunities" and was replaced by Kevin Burns. James Monsees is [[Chief Product Officer]]{{cite report |author= |author-link= |authors= |date=August 31, 2018 |title=2018 Annual Report |url=https://sccefile.scc.virginia.gov/F1972902/AnnualReport |publisher=[[State Corporation Commission]] |docket=F1972902 |access-date=September 28, 2018 |quote= }} and board member at JUUL. Adam Bowen is [[Chief Technology Officer]] and board member at JUUL. Other board members include [[Nicholas J. Pritzker|Nicholas Pritzker]], whose family owned [[chewing tobacco]] giant [[Conwood]], Riaz Valani, and Hoyoung Huh.{{cite news|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/12/19/juul-labs-raising-150-million-in-debt-after-spinning-out-of-pax.html|title=E-cigarette maker Juul is raising $150 million after spinning out of vaping company|first=Ari |last=Levi|publisher=[[CNBC]]|date=December 19, 2017}} As the popularity of the JUUL e-cigarette has taken off, the company has grown quickly, from employing 200 people in September 2017 to 400 in May 2018 to over 800 by September 2018. {{As of|2018|07}}, the JUUL e-cigarette is made in [[Shenzhen, China]], like many other e-cigarettes,{{cite news|last1=Liao|first1=Allen|title=Chinese E-cigarette Makers Shift to Domestic Markets|url=http://www.tobaccoasia.com/features/chinese-e-cigarette-makers-shift-to-domestic-markets/|accessdate=29 February 2016|work=Tobacco Asia|date=1 September 2015}} while the pods are made in the United States.{{cite news |last1=Zaleski |first1=Olivia |title=As Juul Flies High With New Funding, Vapes Become a Target |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-07-10/as-juul-flies-high-with-new-funding-vapes-become-a-target |accessdate=October 4, 2018 |work=Bloomberg |date=July 10, 2018}} === Founders === JUUL Labs was co-founded by two former cigarette smokers, Adam Bowen and James Monsees.{{cite magazine|last=Tolentino |first=Jia |url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2018/05/14/the-promise-of-vaping-and-the-rise-of-juul|title=The Promise of Vaping and the Rise of Juul|work=The New Yorker | date=May 14, 2018 |access-date=September 1, 2018}} They first created a company called Ploom while they were product-design grad students at [[Stanford University]], and later created the Pax vaporizer device for cannabis and loose-leaf tobacco before founding JUUL. {{As of|2018|08}}, Bowen is Chief Technology Officer of JUUL and Monsees is Chief Product Officer. == Design == [[File:Juul.jpg|thumb|right|JUUL vaporizer|alt=JUUL vaporizer]] The JUUL is a type of e-cigarette that uses [[nicotine]] salts (protonated nicotine) that exist in leaf-based [[tobacco]] for its key ingredient, rather than free-base nicotine.{{cite news|url=https://vapenews.com/vape-news/new-product-pax-labs-introduces-e-cigarette-juul/|title=New Product: PAX LABS Introduces E-CIGARETTE JUUL|last=Stahr |first=Alyssa |work=Vape News|date=5 June 2015}} They received a US patent for their nicotine salt preparation in 2015.{{cite news|url=https://theslanted.com/2015/12/21876/pax-secures-patent-for-nicotine-salt-e-cigarette/|title=PAX secures patent for "Nicotine Salt E-Cigarette"|author=Sean Thomas|work=The Slanted|date=December 22, 2015}} The nicotine salts are said to create an experience more like smoking than other e-cigarettes on the market,{{cite web| url = https://techcrunch.com/2015/04/21/pax-juul/| title = Vaporization Startup Pax Labs Introduces Juul, Its Next-Gen E-Cigarette| date = April 20, 2015 | author = Ryan Lawler| work = TechCrunch| accessdate = February 26, 2016 }} as JUUL attempts to deliver a nicotine peak in five minutes, similar to a traditional cigarette. Each cartridge (called a JUULpod) contains about the same amount of nicotine as one pack of cigarettes and delivers approximately 200 puffs.{{cite web| title = Startup behind the Lambo of vaporizers just launched an intelligent e-cigarette| first = Nitasha| last= Tiku| work = The Verge| date = April 21, 2015 | accessdate = September 10, 2015 | url = https://www.theverge.com/2015/4/21/8458629/pax-labs-e-cigarette-juul}} The amount of nicotine in each cartridge—5 percent, or 59 mg/ml—is substantially more than the majority of e-cigarettes on the market. In August 2018, JUUL introduced pods in 3 percent strengths for its mint and Virginia tobacco flavors.{{cite news |last1=LaVito |first1=Angelica |title=Leading e-cig maker Juul to sell lower-nicotine pods as scrutiny ratchets higher |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/07/11/juul-to-introduce-lower-nicotine-pods-for-some-of-its-flavors.html |accessdate=September 28, 2018 |work=CNBC |date=July 12, 2018}} Each cartridge contains [[propylene glycol]], [[glycerol|glycerin]], [[Flavor#Flavorants or flavorings|flavorings]], and nicotine salts.{{Cite web| title = Why The Panic Over JUUL And Teen Vaping May Have Deadly Results| last = Satel | first = Sally| work = Forbes| date = April 11, 2018| accessdate = June 22, 2018| url = https://www.forbes.com/sites/sallysatel/2018/04/11/why-the-panic-over-juul-and-teen-vaping-may-have-deadly-results/#13931ddbea48}} Protonated nicotine lacks the harshness of tobacco smoke.{{cite journal |last1=Sam Wong |title=How worrying is it that more and more teens are using e-cigarettes? |journal=New Scientist |date=Nov 10, 2018 |url=https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg24032034-400-how-worrying-is-it-that-more-and-more-teens-are-using-e-cigarettes/}} According to Tory Spindle of Johns Hopkins University, "Protonated nicotine formulations are problematic because they seemingly allow users to inhale much higher nicotine concentrations that they would otherwise be able to." JUUL pods come in eight flavors, of which mango is the most popular.{{cite news |last=Teitell |first=Beth |url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/2017/11/15/where-teenagers-are-high-school-bathrooms-vaping/IJ6xYWWlOTKqsUGTTlw4UO/story.html |title=‘Juuling’: The most widespread phenomenon you’ve never heard of |work=[[The Boston Globe]] |date=November 16, 2017}} A JUUL starter kit sells for about $49.99.{{cite news |last=Wisniewski|first=Christie|url=http://www.recorder.com/Experts-talk-about-teen-vaping-16937687|title=Vaping, juuling latest threats to teen, pre-teen health|work=[[The Recorder (Massachusetts newspaper)|The Recorder]]|date=April 18, 2018}} The JUUL e-cigarette is shaped like a [[USB flash drive]]{{cite web| title = Juul is the e-cig that will finally stop me from smoking (I hope)| first = Aaron | last=Souppouris| work = Engadget| date = June 3, 2015 | accessdate = September 10, 2015 | url = https://www.engadget.com/2015/06/03/pax-labs-juul-e-cigarette/}} and recharges using a magnetic USB deck. Joel Johnson of ''co.design'' described the nicotine intake as "eye-widening" and its aesthetics as "demure".{{cite web| title = This Is The Keurig Of Vaping, And I Love It| author = Joel Johnson | work = Co.Design| date = April 7, 2017 | accessdate = May 17, 2017 | url = https://www.fastcodesign.com/90109059/this-is-the-keurig-of-vaping-and-i-love-it}} Upon initial release Ben Radding of ''[[Men's Fitness]]'' called JUUL the "iPhone of E-cigs", but said that it required "getting used to."{{cite web| title = Pax Juul: The iPhone of E-cigs?| author = Ben Radding | work = Men's Fitness| accessdate = May 17, 2017 |url=http://www.mensfitness.com/life/gearandtech/pax-juul-iphone-e-cigs}} The comparison to the [[iPhone]] and other Apple products has been made by many other commentators.{{cite news |last1=LaVito |first1=Angelica |title=Juul built an e-cigarette empire. Its popularity with teens threatens its future |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/08/03/juul-e-cigarettes-popularity-among-teens-concerns-schools-fda.html |accessdate=September 24, 2018 |work=CNBC |date=August 4, 2018}} Pharmacologist James Pauly, a specialist in nicotine, notes that JUUL delivers more nicotine than other e-cigarettes, and that the salts also possibly reduce the harshness, making it relatively easy for a new smoker, such as a teenager, to consume more nicotine than they are aware of.{{cite news|url=https://www.sfgate.com/technology/businessinsider/article/juuling-vape-pen-stanford-university-health-effect-12735315.php|title=A vape pen created by Stanford graduates is taking over US high schools — and doctors are frightened|last= Brodwin |first=Erin |newspaper=Business Insider|via=''San Francisco Chronicle''|date=8 March 2018}} == Investors == Current JUUL investors include Tiger Global Management, mutual fund firm [[Fidelity Investments]], and [[Tao Capital]].{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/juul-raises-650-million-in-funding-that-values-e-cig-startup-at-15-billion-1531260832|title=Juul Raises $650 Million in Funding That Values E-Cig Startup at $15 Billion|last=Maloney|first=Jennifer|date=July 10, 2018 |work=Wall Street Journal|access-date=September 1, 2018 |issn=0099-9660}} In June 2018, JUUL reportedly raised $1.2 billion in a financing round that valued the company at more than $16 billion.{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-06-29/e-cigarette-maker-juul-labs-is-raising-1-2-billion| last=Zaleski |first=Olivia |title=E-Cigarette Maker Juul Labs Is Raising $1.2 Billion |work=Bloomberg |date=June 29, 2018 |access-date=September 1, 2018}} == Usage == Using JUUL is very popular among teenagers.{{cite news|last=Chen |first=Angus |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/12/04/568273801/teenagers-embrace-juul-saying-its-discreet-enough-to-vape-in-class|title=Teenagers Embrace JUUL, Saying It's Discreet Enough To Vape In Class |work=NPR |date=December 4, 2017 |accessdate=September 24, 2018}} A 2017 study by the [[Truth Initiative]] found that 7% of teenagers ages 15–17 and 12% of young adults ages 18–24 use JUUL.{{cite journal|last1=Willett|first1=Jeffrey G|last2=Bennett|first2=Morgane|last3=Hair|first3=Elizabeth C|last4=Xiao|first4=Haijuan|last5=Greenberg|first5=Marisa S|last6=Harvey|first6=Emily|last7=Cantrell|first7=Jennifer|last8=Vallone|first8=Donna|title=Recognition, use and perceptions of JUUL among youth and young adults|journal=Tobacco Control|date=18 April 2018|doi=10.1136/tobaccocontrol-2018-054273|pmid=29669749|url=https://truthinitiative.org/sites/default/files/Recognition-use-and-perceptions-of-JUUL-among-youth-and-young-adults.pdf}} Teenagers use the verb "Juuling" to describe their use of JUUL, which frequently takes place in bathroom stalls at school. Former PAX Labs CEO Goldman said to ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' in 2016 that "JUUL should not be used by those under the legal age, nor should any nicotine products, as stated by the U.S. Surgeon General."{{cite news|url=http://fortune.com/2016/12/08/surgeon-general-ecigarettes-vaping/|title=What the Surgeon General’s E-Cigarette Warning Means for the Red-Hot Vaping Industry|author=Tom Huddleston, Jr.|work=Fortune|date=8 December 2016}} In 2018 Matt Myers, president of Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids, said the design "misleads about risk" of addiction.{{cite news|url=http://wjla.com/features/7-on-your-side/are-your-kids-juuling-at-school-7-on-your-side-investigates|title=Are your kids juuling at school? 7 On Your Side investigates|author=Kimberly Suiters|publisher=[[WJLA-TV]]|date=January 31, 2018}} The 2017 Truth Initiative survey found 63% of teens and young adults do not understand that the JUUL they use always contains nicotine. Many reasons have been proposed for JUUL's popularity among teenagers. Among these are its ease of concealment, sleek high-tech design, and JUUL pod flavors. JUUL's resemblance to a flash drive makes it easy to conceal, and its low vapor output and subtle scent, which can be passed off as perfume, mean that it can be used discreetly, even in class. Similarly, the device's small size allows it to be concealed in clothing or elsewhere; a high school in [[Newton, Massachusetts]] discovered a JUUL disguised as a sharpie, for instance.{{cite news |title=Vaping In School Raises Concerns From Administration, Parents |url=https://boston.cbslocal.com/2017/11/16/vape-ecigarette-juul-high-school/ |work=CBS Boston |date=16 November 2017 |language=en}} JUUL's sleek and high-tech design, which is often compared to that of the iPhone, is also often cited as a reason for its popularity with young people. Finally, JUUL's sweet flavors, especially the fruit and [[crème brûlée]] ones, are especially attractive to children, according to journalists, academics, and the [[U.S. Food and Drug Administration]]. In response, JUUL renamed some flavors—"cool cucumber" to "cucumber" and "crème brûlée" to "creme"—saying that it “heard the criticism” and “responded by simplifying the names and losing the descriptors.” A 2018 Truth Initiative survey found that 74% of JUUL users ages 12–17 got their device from a brick and mortar store, 52% got theirs from a friend or family member, and only 6% got theirs online (respondents could select multiple answers).{{cite web |title=Where are kids getting JUUL? |url=https://truthinitiative.org/news/where-are-kids-getting-juul |website=Truth Initiative |accessdate=October 28, 2018 |language=en |date=May 29, 2018}} For context, JUUL estimates that 90% of its sales are in brick and mortar stores. == Food and Drug Administration investigations == In April 2018, the US [[Food and Drug Administration]] (FDA) requested that JUUL Labs turn over documents to "better understand the reportedly high rates of youth use and the particular youth appeal of these products."{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/27/science/juul-vaping-teen-marketing.html|title=Did Juul Lure Teenagers and Get ‘Customers for Life’?|work=[[The New York Times]]|last1=Richtel |first1=Matt |last2=Kaplan |first2=Sheila |date=August 27, 2018}} The FDA's request included asking the company to provide documents about the design and marketing of the JUUL, research on the safety of the products, and whether certain features of the device's design appeal to specific age groups. FDA also asked [[eBay]] to remove several listings of JUUL products, which eBay complied with. [[FDA commissioner]] Dr. [[Scott Gottlieb]] expressed concern about how the JUUL can be easily disguised as a USB flash drive and that the JUUL delivers a high amount of nicotine.{{cite press release |last=Gottlieb |first=Scott |date= April 24, 2018 |title=Statement from FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb, M.D., on new enforcement actions and a Youth Tobacco Prevention Plan to stop youth use of, and access to, JUUL and other e-cigarettes |url=https://www.fda.gov/NewsEvents/Newsroom/PressAnnouncements/ucm605432.htm |location=[[Silver Spring, MD]] |publisher=[[Food and Drug Administration]]|access-date=April 27, 2018}} "We don’t yet fully understand why these products are so popular among youth," Dr. Gottlieb said, adding that "These documents may help us get there."{{cite news| issn = 0362-4331| last = Zernike| first = Kate| title = F.D.A. Cracks Down on ‘Juuling’ Among Teenagers| work = [[The New York Times]]| accessdate = 2018-04-27| date = 2018-04-24| url = https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/24/health/fda-e-cigarettes-minors-juul.html}} In response, JUUL Labs stated that they would spend $30 million on a campaign to keep JUUL out of the hands of young people in addition to working with the FDA, which they announced in a press release in April 2018.{{cite press release |last=Davis |first=Victoria |date= April 25, 2018 |title=JUUL Labs Announces Comprehensive Strategy to Combat Underage Use|url=https://www.juullabs.com/juul-labs-announces-comprehensive-strategy-to-combat-underage-use/ |location=[[San Francisco]] |publisher=JUUL Labs, Inc.|access-date=April 27, 2018}} JUUL Labs also announced their support for raising the minimum age for vaping products from 18 to 21.{{cite news| issn = 0362-4331| title = JUUL Maker to Invest $30M to Combat Underage Vaping| work = [[The New York Times]]| agency=Associated Press |accessdate = 2018-04-27| date = 2018-04-25| url = https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2018/04/25/us/politics/ap-us-e-cigarette-crackdown-juul-response.html}} JUUL Labs CEO Kevin Burns said, "we are committed to deterring young people, as well as adults who do not currently smoke from using our products. We cannot be more emphatic on this point: No young person or non-nicotine user should ever try JUUL."{{cite web|url=https://www.medpagetoday.com/pulmonology/smoking/72573|title=JUUL Maker Vows to Combat Teen Use of E-Cigarette|author=Salynn Boyles|website=[[Everyday Health|MedPage Today]]|date=27 April 2018}} The FDA followed up by issuing more than 60 warning letters and fines to stores that were found to be illegally selling JUUL products to minors.{{cite web |title=Warning Letters and Civil Money Penalties Issued to Retailers for Selling JUUL and Other E-Cigarettes to Minors |url=https://www.fda.gov/TobaccoProducts/NewsEvents/ucm605278.htm |website=FDA Center for Tobacco Products |accessdate=September 26, 2018 |language=en |date=September 12, 2018}} In September 2018, the FDA sent letters to JUUL Labs and the manufacturers of the four other largest e-cigarette brands in the US—[[R.J. Reynolds]]' [[Vuse]], [[Altria]]'s [[MarkTen]], [[Imperial Brands]]' [[blu eCigs]], and [[Japan Tobacco International]]'s [[LOGIC (electronic cigarette)|Logic]]—giving them 60 days to lay out their plans to address widespread youth use of their products.{{cite press release |last=Gottlieb |first=Scott |date=September 12, 2018 |title=FDA takes new steps to address epidemic of youth e-cigarette use, including a historic action against more than 1,300 retailers and 5 major manufacturers for their roles perpetuating youth access |url=https://www.fda.gov/NewsEvents/Newsroom/PressAnnouncements/ucm620184.htm |location=[[Silver Spring, MD]] |publisher=[[Food and Drug Administration]]| |access-date=September 26, 2018}} If they fail to comply, FDA may "remove some or all of their flavored products that may be contributing to the rise in youth use from the market." FDA also sent over 1,300 warning letters to stores that undercover investigators had found to be selling JUUL and other e-cigarettes to minors, and issued 131 fines ranging from $279 to $11,182.{{cite news |last1=Kaplan |first1=Sheila |last2=Hoffman |first2=Jan |title=F.D.A. Targets Vaping, Alarmed by Teenage Use |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/12/health/juul-fda-vaping-ecigarettes.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage |accessdate=September 26, 2018 |work=The New York Times |date=September 12, 2018 |language=en |page=A1}} JUUL responded with a statement that "JUUL Labs will work proactively with FDA in response to its request."{{cite press release |last=Davis |first=Victoria |date=September 12, 2018 |title=Statement From Kevin Burns, JUUL Labs Chief Executive Officer, Regarding Recent FDA Request |url=https://support.juul.com/learn/read/juul-labs-fda-request-statement |location=San Francisco |publisher=JUUL Labs |agency= |access-date=September 26, 2018}} A JUUL spokeswoman also announced that JUUL has its own patrol of retailers who advertise to youths or who do not enforce age requirements, noting that it had requested the removal of over 5,500 posts from [[Instagram]], 144 posts from [[Facebook Marketplace]], and 33 from [[Amazon.com]]. In total, Instagram removed 4,562 of 5,500 posts, Facebook Marketplace removed 45 of 145, and Amazon took down 13 of 33. An April 2018 survey by the Truth Initiative found that 89% of adolescents who attempted to buy JUUL online succeeded, however, and Gottlieb said that JUUL's efforts "didn’t have the intended impact or I wouldn’t be viewing the statistics I’m now seeing." The FDA made an unannounced inspection of JUUL headquarters in late September 2018 to gather information on the firm's marketing methods.{{cite news |author1=RNN Staff |title=FDA seizes documents from e-cigarette maker in broader crackdown on underage vaping |url=http://www.wect.com/2018/10/03/fda-seizes-documents-e-cigarette-maker-broader-crackdown-underage-vaping/ |accessdate=October 4, 2018 |work=[[WECT]] |agency=[[RNN, Regional News Network|RNN]] |date=October 2, 2018}} FDA announced afterwards that it had seized thousands of pages of documents on JUUL Labs' marketing practices.{{cite news |last1=LaVito |first1=Angelica |title=FDA seizes documents in surprise inspection of e-cigarette maker Juul |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/10/02/fda-seizes-documents-in-surprise-inspection-of-e-cigarette-maker-juul.html |accessdate=October 4, 2018 |work=CNBC |date=October 2, 2018}} Shares of three [[Big Tobacco]] companies—[[Altria]], [[Philip Morris International]], and [[British American Tobacco]]—rose at the news of the inspection. On November 13, 2018, 60 days after the FDA's ultimatum, JUUL announced it would stop accepting retail orders for mango, fruit, creme, and cucumber JUUL pods in compliance with the FDA's investigation. JUUL will continue to sell tobacco, mint and menthol pods in retail stores, and noted that it will renew retails sales of its other flavors at stores that that invest in age-verification technology. In addition, the company said they would shut down their Facebook and Instagram accounts in the U.S. that promote the use of flavored pods, which entice underage users.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/13/health/juul-ecigarettes-vaping-teenagers.html|last1=Kaplan|first1=Sheila|last2=Hoffman|first2=Jan|title=Juul Will Stop Selling Most E-Cigarette Flavors in Stores and Halt Social Media Promotions|work=The New York Times |date=November 13, 2018 |access-date=November 19, 2018|language=en}} == Market share == === United States === Sales of JUUL increased 700% in 2016. {{Asof|2018|10}}, JUUL accounts for over 70% of the US e-cigarette market monitored by [[Nielsen Corporation|Nielsen]].{{cite news |last1=Craver |first1=Richard |title=Juul expands e-cig market share gap with Reynolds' Vuse |url=https://www.journalnow.com/business/juul-expands-e-cig-market-share-gap-with-reynolds-vuse/article_0bb4d442-fc0f-5c00-8b05-29bbf95dc985.html |accessdate=28 August 2018 |work=Winston-Salem Journal |date=25 August 2018}} JUUL's market share in the US has increased by 10 percentage points since April 2018.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-06-14/e-cig-maker-juul-won-t-tempt-instagrammers-with-models-anymore|title=E-Cig Maker Juul Won't Tempt Instagrammers With Models Anymore|last=Wolf|first=Janine|publisher=Bloomberg News|date=14 June 2018}} According to JUUL Labs, 90% of JUUL products are purchased at retail stores {{as of|2018|08|lc=on}}. JUUL plans to sell their products internationally.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-06-29/e-cigarette-maker-juul-labs-is-raising-1-2-billion|title=E-Cigarette Maker Juul Labs Is Raising $1.2 Billion|last=Zaleski|first=Olivia|publisher=[[Bloomberg News]]|date=29 June 2018}} According to Dow Jones VentureSource, JUUL Labs was the sixth-most valuable US startup in July 2018, behind companies like [[Uber Technologies Inc.]] and [[Airbnb|Airbnb Inc.]] JUUL’s revenue in 2017 was approximately $245 million and projected to be $940 million in 2018,{{cite web |last=Primack |first=Dan |url=https://www.axios.com/numbers-juul-investor-appeal-vaping-22c0a2f9-beb1-4a48-acee-5da64e3e2f82.html|title=Scoop: The numbers behind Juul's investor appeal|website=Axios|language=en| date=July 2, 2018 |access-date=September 24, 2018}} while sales totaled $1.1 billion for the year ending July 2018.{{cite news |last1=Tobin |first1=Ben |title=FDA targets e-cigarettes like Juul as teachers fear 'epidemic' use by students |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2018/08/16/juul-labs-back-school-teachers-e-cigarettes/917531002/ |accessdate=25 September 2018 |work=USA Today |date=13 September 2018 |language=en}} JUUL's success has inspired a flood of imitators, namely pod-mod devices with similar boxy designs.{{cite web |title=JUUL copycats are flooding the e-cigarette market |url=https://truthinitiative.org/news/juul-copycats-are-flooding-market |website=Truth Initiative |accessdate=October 28, 2018 |language=en |date=August 8, 2018}} These devices come from companies ranging from startups to Big Tobacco company R.J. Reynolds.{{cite news |last1=Craver |first1=Richard |title=Reynolds Vapor prepares national launch of new e-cig rival to Juul |url=https://www.journalnow.com/business/reynolds-vapor-prepares-national-launch-of-new-e-cig-rival/article_7ba10442-d438-575e-af23-794173089a8a.html |accessdate=28 August 2018 |work=Winston-Salem Journal |date=17 July 2018}} The company filed a complaint with the U.S. International Trade Commission (ITC) in early October 2018 over counterfeit products manufactured by companies in the United States and China that JUUL Labs says infringed on its US patents. The complaint seeks to end importation of these products into the US.{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-juul-ecigarettes-patents/e-cigarette-maker-juul-files-complaints-against-copycat-products-idUSKCN1ME127|title=E-cigarette maker Juul files complaints against 'copycat products'|last=Geller|first=Martinne|work=Reuters|access-date=October 4, 2018|date= October 4, 2018 |language=en-US}} === International === In May 2018, JUUL started selling in Israel, which did not regulate e-cigarettes at the time.{{cite news|url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/business/juul-warns-it-will-fight-israel-over-potential-ban-on-its-e-cigarettes-1.6140058|title=Juul Warns It Will Fight Israel Over Potential Ban on Its E-cigarettes|first=Ronny |last=Linder-Ganz|work=[[Haaretz]]|date=3 June 2018}} Israel later banned JUUL in August 2018, citing public health concerns, according to a statement by the [[Ministry of Health (Israel)|Ministry of Health]]. Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]], acting in his capacity as Health Minister, placed a complete ban on JUUL because it delivers nearly three times Israel's recommended amount of 20 mg/ml of nicotine.{{cite news|last1=Ben-Ozer|first1=Tamar|last2=Levi|first2=Sarah|url=https://www.jpost.com/HEALTH-SCIENCE/Israel-bans-JUUL-electronic-cigarettes-565442|title=Israel bans high-nicotine Juul e-cigarettes|work=The Jerusalem Post|date=August 23, 2018|accessdate=August 28, 2018}} JUUL has appealed the ban to Israel's [[Supreme Court of Israel#High Court of Justice|High Court of Justice]].{{cite news |last1=Linder-Ganz |first1=Ronny |title=Juul Asks Israel's Top Court to Block Ban on E-cigarettes |url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/business/juul-asks-israel-s-top-court-to-block-ban-on-e-cigarettes-1.6411472 |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Haaretz |date=23 August 2018}} In July 2018, JUUL announced it would launch in the United Kingdom.{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-juul-britain/fast-growing-e-cigarette-maker-juul-to-launch-in-uk-idUSKBN1K62WC|title=Fast-growing e-cigarette maker Juul to launch in UK|last=Geller|first=Martinne|work=Reuters |date=July 16, 2018 |access-date=September 1, 2018|language=en-US}} In August 2018, JUUL introduced its products into Canada, starting with an online launch before introducing them to vape shops, gas stations, and convenience stores in early September.{{cite news |last1=Peng |first1=Jenny |title=Vaping giant Juul plans Canadian e-cig domination amid concerns from youth groups |url=https://www.thestar.com/business/2018/08/30/vaping-giant-juul-plans-canadian-e-cig-domination-amid-success-and-controversy-in-us.html |accessdate=September 28, 2018 |work=The Star |date=August 30, 2018 |location=Vancouver |language=en}} == Marketing == JUUL is intensively marketed via Instagram and other [[social media]].{{Cite web| title = Study says vaping by kids isn't up, but some are skeptical| last = Stobbe | first = Mike| work = The Sentinel| date = June 11, 2018| accessdate = June 25, 2018| url = https://cumberlink.com/live_well_in_the_cumberland_valley/study-says-vaping-by-kids-isn-t-up-but-some/article_35fe8093-dabe-5c24-969c-eaebdbfbe51b.html}} Of the $2.2 million JUUL spent on marketing in 2015 and 2016, $1 million went to online marketing, according to data from [[Kantar Media]].{{Cite journal| doi = 10.1136/tobaccocontrol-2018-054382| last1 = Huang| first1 = Jidong| last2 = Duan| first2 = Zongshuan| last3 = Kwok| first3 = Julian| last4 = Binns| first4 = Steven| last5 = Vera| first5 = Lisa E.| last6 = Kim| first6 = Yoonsang| last7 = Szczypka| first7 = Glen| last8 = Emery| first8 = Sherry L.| title = Vaping versus JUULing: how the extraordinary growth and marketing of JUUL transformed the US retail e-cigarette market| journal = Tobacco Control| accessdate = 2018-09-26| date = May 2018| url = https://tobaccocontrol.bmj.com/content/early/2018/05/31/tobaccocontrol-2018-054382| pmid = 29853561}} JUUL's heavy reliance on social media marketing is unique among major e-cigarette brands in the US—blu and NJOY were initially promoted mainly with television advertising while Vuse and MarkTen relied on promotional expenditures to consumers and retailers—and is touted as a major reason for its success. JUUL's use of social media marketing is also relatively inexpensive: to promote Vuse, [[R. J. Reynolds Vapor Company]] spent over $16 million on television ads alone in 2015 and 2016, according to Kantar data. A 2018 study found that "JUUL’s social media activities were highly correlated with JUUL retail sales." JUUL's marketing has been criticized for targeting youth. The themes emphasized in JUUL's marketing, especially freedom, relaxation, and sex appeal; the use of young models and imagery claimed to be appealing to young people; and the use of social media "[[influencer]]s" and affiliates popular among youth are three reasons why some consider JUUL's marketing to be targeting youth. In 2015, John Schachter, director of state communications for Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids (CTFK), voiced concern regarding the youth of men and women portrayed in JUUL's advertising, particularly in combination with the design, stating that "We're seeing more and more irresponsible marketing of unregulated products such as e-cigarettes."{{cite news|url=http://adage.com/article/cmo-strategy/juul-hopes-reinvent-e-cigarette-ads-campaign/299142/|title=Juul Hopes To Reinvent E-Cigarette Ads with 'Vaporized' Campaign|first=Declan |last=Harty |work=[[Advertising Age]]|date=June 23, 2015}} Similarly, CTFK Vice President of Communications Wilmore stated that JUUL Labs "used the same imagery and themes that tobacco companies have always used to appeal to kids, and they fueled it with social media." JUUL Labs argues that its marketing is targeted at adult cigarette smokers who are looking to quit. The rectangular design of the JUUL e-cigarette, for example, was chosen to avoid reminding smokers of a cigarette, according to a JUUL executive.{{cite news |title=Teens are hooked on Juul, but a top exec insists that was never the company's intention |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/juul-ecigarette-executive-addresses-concerns-product-appeals-directly-to-teens-vaping/ |accessdate=September 28, 2018 |work=CBS News |date=June 14, 2018 |language=en}} In 2018, JUUL implemented a new marketing code to avoid the appearance of targeting youth.{{cite press release |last=David |first=Victoria |date= June 14, 2018 |title=JUUL Labs Implements New Social Media Policy for Instagram, Facebook and Twitter in Ongoing Effort to Combat Underage Use and Drive Awareness of Mission to Help Adult Smokers |url=https://support.juul.com/learn/read/juul-labs-implements-new-social-media-policy |location=San Francisco |publisher=JUUL Labs |access-date=September 26, 2018}} Changes brought about by the new code include only showcasing former smokers age 35 or older in ads, no longer featuring models on social media, removing social media accounts that marketed to teenagers, including @Doit4JUUL, which had more followers than the main JUUL account, and adding the label "the alternative for adult smokers" to its packaging and many of its ads. JUUL's marketing has been the focus of two lawsuits filed against the company since April 2018. The suits, both filed in California, claim that JUUL was deceptively marketed as safe even though a JUUL pod contains as much nicotine as an average pack of cigarettes. According to the first suit, filed in US District Court in April, "the intense dosage of nicotine salts delivered by the Juul products resulted in an increased nicotine addiction, and an increased consumption of nicotine by [plaintiff] Colgate."{{cite news |last1=Tiku |first1=Nitasha |title=Users Sue Juul for Addicting Them to Nicotine |url=https://www.wired.com/story/users-sue-juul-for-addicting-them-to-nicotine/ |accessdate=September 24, 2018 |work=Wired |date=July 23, 2018}} == Health concerns == JUUL's health concerns have been debated.{{cite web|first=David |last=Pierce|url=https://www.wired.com/2015/04/pax-juul-ecig/|title=This Might Just Be the First Great E-Cig|work=Wired |date=April 21, 2015}} Ari Atkins, Pax Labs' R&D engineer, said "We don’t think a lot about addiction here because we’re not trying to design a cessation product at all." He added, "anything about health is not on our mind."{{cite news|url=https://www.theverge.com/2015/4/21/8458629/pax-labs-e-cigarette-juul|title=Startup behind the Lambo of vaporizers just launched an intelligent e-cigarette|first=Nitasha |last=Tiku |work=[[The Verge]]|date=April 21, 2015}} In April 2018, [[Food and Drug Administration|FDA]] Commissioner Dr. Scott Gottlieb stated that the nicotine in JUUL is sufficient to result in addiction. Gottlieb further stated, "In some cases, our kids are trying these products and liking them without even knowing they contain nicotine. And that’s a problem, because as we know the nicotine in these products can rewire an adolescent’s brain, leading to years of addiction." Concerns about the effect of nicotine delivered by JUUL on the developing adolescent brain have led to a lawsuit against the company. The suit, filed in US District Court in New York in June 2018, alleges that JUUL contains more nicotine than necessary to satisfy an adult smoker, and that use of JUUL by the 15-year old son of the [[plaintiff]] made him "heavily addicted to nicotine" causing him to be "anxious, highly irritable and prone to angry outbursts." == References == {{reflist}} == Further reading == {{refbegin}} * {{cite news |last1=Barshad |first1=Amos |title=The Juul Is Too Cool |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=April 7, 2018 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/07/style/the-juul-is-too-cool.html |issn=0362-4331 |df=mdy-all }} * {{cite news |last1=Bellafante |first1=Ginia |title=Cool-Looking and Sweet, Juul Is a Vice Teens Can’t Resist |work=The New York Times |date=2018-02-16 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/16/nyregion/juul-teenagers-vaping-ecigarettes-dangers.html |issn=0362-4331 |df=mdy-all }} * {{cite journal|last1=Kavuluru|first1=Ramakanth|last2=Han|first2=Sifei|last3=Hahn|first3=Ellen J|title=On the popularity of the USB flash drive-shaped electronic cigarette Juul|journal=[[Tobacco Control (journal)|Tobacco Control]]|date=13 April 2018|doi=10.1136/tobaccocontrol-2018-054259|pmid=29654121| issn = 1468-3318}} * {{cite journal|last1=Willett|first1=Jeffrey G|last2=Bennett|first2=Morgane|last3=Hair|first3=Elizabeth C|last4=Xiao|first4=Haijuan|last5=Greenberg|first5=Marisa S|last6=Harvey|first6=Emily|last7=Cantrell|first7=Jennifer|last8=Vallone|first8=Donna|title=Recognition, use and perceptions of JUUL among youth and young adults|journal=Tobacco Control|date=18 April 2018|doi=10.1136/tobaccocontrol-2018-054273|pmid=29669749|url=https://truthinitiative.org/sites/default/files/Recognition-use-and-perceptions-of-JUUL-among-youth-and-young-adults.pdf}} == External links == {{commonscat|Juul vaping device|JUUL}} * {{Official|https://www.juul.com}} {{Cigarettes}} [[Category:Electronic cigarettes]] [[Category:Electronics companies established in 2017]] [[Category:Companies based in San Francisco]] [[Category:2017 establishments in California]] [[Category:Electronic cigarette manufacturers]]

revision.comment: standard quote handling in WP;standard Apostrophe/quotation marks in WP; MOS general fixes

revision.text:
{{Infobox lake | name = Krasnoyarsk Reservoir | image = Pier in Novosyolovo.jpg | caption = Pier in Novosyolovo in the lake | image_bathymetry = | caption_bathymetry = | location = [[Krasnoyarsk krai]] | coords = {{coord|54|55|N|91|40|E|region:RU_type:waterbody_scale:2000000|display=inline,title}} | type = [[Hydroelectric]] [[Reservoir (water)|reservoir]] | inflow = [[Yenisei River|Yenisei]], [[Tuba River|Tuba]], [[Sisim River|Sisim]], [[Biryusa River|Biryusa]] | outflow = | catchment = | basin_countries = [[Russia]] | length = | width = | area = {{convert|2000|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}} | depth = {{convert|37|m|ft|abbr=on}} | max-depth = {{convert|105|m|ft|abbr=on}} | volume = | residence_time = | shore = | elevation = {{convert|243|m|ft|abbr=on}} | frozen = | islands = | cities = [[Abakan]] | reference = }} '''Krasnoyarsk Reservoir''', known also as the '''Krasnoyarsk Sea''', is an [[artificial lake]] which was created by the construction of the [[Krasnoyarsk Dam]]. It is one of the largest artificial reservoirs in the world. In Russia, it now ranks second (after the [[Bratsk Reservoir]]).
The top point of the reservoir is located near the town of Abakan, at the confluence of the Yenisei river Abakan. Lower spot - Krasnoyarsk hydroelectric power station dam. The distance from the top point to the Krasnoyarsk hydroelectric power station on the line - about 250 kilometers, but the total length of the reservoir is much more - 388 kilometers. Width at widest points is 15 kilometers. Height of the water's edge - 243 meters above sea level.
In the reservoir flow some pretty major rivers, including the right bank - Tuba, Sisim, Syda, on the left - Biryusa. At the confluence of the rivers flow directly into the previously Yenisei, creating reservoirs formed bays. The most significant of them - Tubin, Syda, Karasug, Sisim, Durbin, Biryusinsk.
The largest settlements located on the shore of the reservoir are regional centers Abakan, Krasnoturansk (located on the Bay Syda) and Novoselovo. Bridges over the reservoir absent nearest bridge across the Yenisei located a few kilometers above and below the reservoir. However, through the reservoir ferry connections, particularly from the villages and Novoselovo Bellyk. Until the early 1990s, there was a passenger-carrying hydrofoil in the reservoir.
When creating the reservoir, the location of one of the first Russian settlements in Siberia was flooded. It had been populated by Khakassky tribes - Abakan fort (near modern Krasnoturansk). {{commons category|Krasnoyarsk Reservoir}}
[[Category:Reservoirs built in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Reservoirs in Russia]] [[Category:Reservoirs in Krasnoyarsk Krai]]

{{unreferenced|date=July 2014}}{{Infobox lake | name = Lake Tanuki | image = 070127 tanuki-fuji.jpg | caption = | image_bathymetry = | caption_bathymetry = | location = [[Shizuoka Prefecture]] | coords = {{coord|35|20|37|N|138|33|38|E|region:JP_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | type = Reservoir | inflow = | outflow = | catchment = | basin_countries = Japan | length = {{convert|1.0|km|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|0.5|km|abbr=on}} | area = {{convert|0.312|km2|abbr=on}} | depth = {{convert|8|m|abbr=on}} | max-depth = | volume = {{convert|0.0012|km3|acre.ft|abbr=on}} | residence_time = | shore = | elevation = {{convert|660|m|abbr=on}} | frozen = | islands = | cities = [[Fujinomiya, Shizuoka]] }}
{{nihongo|'''Lake Tanuki '''|田貫湖|Tanuki-ko}} is a [[lake]] near [[Mount Fuji]], [[Japan]]. It is located in [[Fujinomiya, Shizuoka|Fujinomiya]], [[Shizuoka Prefecture]], and is part of the [[Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park]].
==History== Originally a swampy area, the lake was created in 1935 by diverting the waters of nearby Shiba River to create a reservoir for use in irrigation. The lake is now a popular vacation location, with camp sites, fishing, boating and is noted for its views of Mount Fuji.
==External links== *{{Commons category-inline|Lake Tanuki}} *[http://www.city.fujinomiya.shizuoka.jp/kankou/meisho/index.htm#05 Fujinomiya home page] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090122021712/http://www.sizenken.biodic.go.jp/pc/live/cgi-bin/live.cgi?camera=18&area=04 Ministry of the Environment home page]
[[Category:Reservoirs in Japan|Tanuki]] [[Category:Landforms of Shizuoka Prefecture]] [[Category:Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Shizuoka Prefecture]]

{{italic title}} {{Infobox film | name = Lipsett Diaries | image = LipsettDiaries2010Poster.jpg | alt = | caption = Film poster | director = [[Theodore Ushev]] | producer = Marc Bertrand | writer = [[Chris Robinson (writer)|Chris Robinson]] | narrator = [[Xavier Dolan]] | starring = Samuel Jacques
Jarvis Robinson Neall | music = | cinematography = | editing = Oana Suteu
[[Theodore Ushev]] | studio = [[National Film Board of Canada|NFB]] | distributor = | released = {{Film date|2010|06||[[Animafest Zagreb]]}} | runtime = 14 minutes | country = Canada | language = French | budget = | gross = }} '''''Lipsett Diaries''''' ({{lang-fr|Les journaux de Lipsett}}) is a 2010 short [[animated documentary]] about the life and art of [[collage film]]maker [[Arthur Lipsett]], animated and directed by [[Theodore Ushev]] and written by [[Chris Robinson (writer)|Chris Robinson]].{{cite news|last=Cahute|first=Larissa|title=Genie Awards: Finding the 'crazy manic sides'|url=https://ottawacitizen.com/health/Genie+Awards+Finding+crazy+manic+sides/4414021/story.html#ixzz1GXELGIXa|accessdate=14 March 2011|newspaper=[[Ottawa Citizen]]|date=10 March 2011}} The 14-minute film was produced by the [[National Film Board of Canada]] in [[Montreal]], where Lipsett had worked from 1958 to 1972, before committing suicide in 1986. The film is narrated by [[Xavier Dolan]].{{cite web|title=Lipsett Diaries|url=http://www.onf-nfb.gc.ca/eng/collection/film/?id=57550|work=Collection|publisher=National Film Board of Canada|accessdate=28 October 2010}} ==Inspiration== Ushev was inspired to make a film about Lipsett, after Robinson had forwarded him an email where the late filmmaker was discussed. Until that point, Ushev had never heard of Lipsett. He began to do some research and was surprised to learn that Lipsett had lived on the same street as him in Montreal. Ushev went to the building where Lipsett once lived and met with the [[concierge]], who showed him a locker where belongings from former tenants were stored. There, Ushev discovered a small blue notebook with "Lipsett" written on it, containing notes by the late filmmaker.{{cite book|last=Robinson|first=Chris|title=Animators Unearthed: A Guide to the Best of Contemporary Animation|publisher=Continuum|isbn=978-0-8264-2956-8|pages=130–131|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=oozKz8Hu4xIC&pg=PA130 |authorlink=Chris Robinson (Ottawa)|accessdate=8 September 2011|date=3 June 2010}} ==Production== The film was animated by hand-painting the frames, using computer editing to link the images. Ushev estimated that 40 frames were painted per day during production. ''Lipsett Diaries'' was Robinson's first attempt at screenwriting. A year after completing his script detailing Lipsett's troubled life, including his battle with [[bipolar disorder]], Robinson was himself diagnosed with a mild form of the condition. ==Reception== ''Lipsett Diaries'' received the [[Genie Award for Best Animated Short]] at the [[31st Genie Awards]].{{cite news|last=Wilner|first=Norman|title=Divvying up the Genies|url=http://www.nowtoronto.com/daily/movies/story.cfm?content=179583|accessdate=13 March 2011|newspaper=[[Now (newspaper)|Now]]|date=10 March 2011}} In June 2011, it received three awards at the 2011 [[Golden Sheaf Awards]]: for Animation, the Founder’s Award, and Best of Festival.{{cite news|last=Wilger|first=Devin|title=Lipsett Diaries captures top honor|url=http://www.yorktonnews.com/article/20110602/YORKTONNEWS0101/306029986/-1/YORKTONNEWS/lipsett-diaries-captures-top-honor|accessdate=8 September 2011|newspaper=Yorkton News Review|date=2 June 2011}} ''Lipsett Diaries'' also received a Special Jury Award at the [[Annecy International Animation Film Festival]], a Special International Jury Prize at the [[Hiroshima International Animation Festival]], an audience award at the [[Melbourne International Animation Festival]], Best Canadian Film at the [[Ottawa International Animation Festival]], special mentions at the Bravo!FACT Awards and Worldwide Short Film Festival in Toronto, Best Animated Film at Clermont-Ferrand Short Film Festival, and the grand prize at the Rencontres internationales du cinéma d'animation in [[Wissembourg]].{{cite news|last=Borowiecki|first=Anna|title=Film board wants to animate the public |url=http://www.stalbertgazette.com/article/20101027/SAG0302/310279984/film-board-wants-to-animate-the-public|accessdate=27 October 2010|newspaper=St. Albert Gazette |date=27 October 2010}}{{cite news|last=McLean|first=Thomas J.|title=Canada's Geni Awards Name 'Lipset Diaries' Best Short|url=http://www.animationmagazine.net/events/canadas-genie-awards-name-lipsett-diaries-best-short/|accessdate=9 September 2011|newspaper=[[Animation Magazine]]|date=14 May 2011}} At the end of 2010, the film was included in the [[Toronto International Film Festival]]'s Top 10 Canadian films of the year.{{cite news|title=‘Barney’s Version,’ ‘Splice,’ ‘Incendies’ land on TIFF’s best of the year list |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/arts/movies/barneys-version-splice-incendies-land-on-tiffs-best-of-the-year-list/article1837843/|accessdate=6 January 2011|newspaper=[[The Globe and Mail]]|date=14 December 2010|agency=[[Canadian Press]]}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb title}} *{{bcdb title|128177}} *{{Official website|https://www.nfb.ca/film/lipsett_diaries/}} (requires [[Adobe Flash]]) *{{YouTube|0jUP8g3oKBU|Watch the film on the NFB's channel}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20100606234007/http://www.lipsettdiaries.net/ Filmmaker's blog] {{Arthur Lipsett}} [[Category:2010 short films]] [[Category:Animated documentary films]] [[Category:Documentary films about film directors and producers]] [[Category:Short documentary films]] [[Category:Films directed by Theodore Ushev]] [[Category:Canadian films]] [[Category:Canadian animated short films]] [[Category:National Film Board of Canada animated short films]] [[Category:National Film Board of Canada documentaries]] [[Category:Documentary films about mental health]] [[Category:Best Animated Short Film Genie and Canadian Screen Award winners]] [[Category:2010s documentary films]] [[Category:Films set in Montreal]] [[Category:Documentary films about the cinema of Canada]] [[Category:2010s animated short films]] [[Category:2010 animated films]] [[Category:Canadian short documentary films]]

The '''Little Baby Face Foundation''' is a [[New York City]]-based charitable organization whose goal is to provide free [[cosmetic surgery]] for children born with facial deformities, and/or who are bullied because of their appearance.<ref>{{cite news|author=07/28/2012 2:14 am Updated: 07/28/2012 1:57 pm |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/28/nadia-isle-bullied-georgi_n_1712548.html |title=Nadia Ilse, Bullied Georgia Teen, Receives Free Plastic Surgery From Little Baby Face Foundation |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date=2012-07-28 |accessdate=2013-06-19}}</ref> Critics have charged that the Foundation's treatment of non-pathological cases overemphasize changing the bullied rather than the bullies.<ref name=Tormented>[http://www.today.com/health/tormented-over-their-looks-bullied-teens-seek-free-plastic-surgery-2D11851011 Tormented over their looks? Bullied teens seek free plastic surgery from a NYC nonprofit], by Melissa Dahl, at ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]''; published January 5, 2014; retrieved December 23, 2016</ref>
The Little Baby Face Foundation was founded in 2002, based on a new model of treatment to help children born with facial deformities, and features such as protruding ears.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/04/14/7-year-old-plastic-surgery_n_849156.html |title=7-Year-Old Samantha Shaw Gets Plastic Surgery To Prevent Bullying (VIDEO) |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= 2011-04-14|accessdate=2013-06-19 |first=Hilary |last=Moss}}</ref> Rather than traveling to third world countries for the treatment of a limited number of conditions, LBFF brings children suffering from all kinds of facial deformities and imperfections to facilities in New York, where physicians and surgeons volunteer their services.
The Little Baby Face Foundation qualifies as a [[501(c)(3)]] [[nonprofit]] by the [[Internal Revenue Service]].
==References==
{{reflist}}
== External links == *[http://www.littlebabyface.org/ Official website]
[[Category:Health charities in the United States]] [[Category:Oral and maxillofacial surgery organizations]] [[Category:Plastic surgery organizations]] [[Category:Medical and health organizations based in New York (state)]]
{{US-health-org-stub}}

revision.text:
{{more footnotes|date=September 2012}} {{Infobox hospital | Name = National Sanatorium Miyako Nanseien | Org/Group = | Image = | Caption = | map_type = | latitude = | longitude = | Logo = | Location = 888, Shimajiri, Hirara, [[Miyakojima, Okinawa]] | Region = | State = | Country = Japan | Coordinates = | HealthCare = HealthCare of those who had leprosy | Type = National hospital run by [[Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (Japan)]] | Speciality = Internal medicine, Surgery, Dermatology, Ophthalmoloty, Otorhi nolaryngology, Dentistry | Standards = | Emergency = | Affiliation = | Beds = 258(Japanese law on health and medicine in 2008), 181(in-patients) | Founded = 1931 | Closed = | Website = http://www.nanseien.com/ | Wiki-Links = |}} '''Miyako Nanseien Sanatorium''', ('''National Sanatorium Miyako Nanseien''') is a sanatorium for [[leprosy]] and ex-leprosy patients at [[Miyakojima, Okinawa|Miyakojima]], [[Okinawa Prefecture]], [[Japan]], starting in 1931.
==History==
===Background=== Following the establishment of 5 prefectural sanatoriums in 1909, the treatment of patients in Okinawa Prefecture was inconsistent, because of the presence of resistance to the establishment of sanatoriums. On the [[Miyako Island]], however, the resistance was relatively low.
===Miyako Hoyoen and Miyako Sanatorium=== * March 6, 1931: Okinawa Prefectural Miyako Hoyoen Sanatorium was opened. * Oct 6, 1933: National (transient) Sanatorium Miyako Santorium.
===Miyako Nanseien Sanatorium=== * Jul 1, 1941: National Sanatorium Miyako Nanseien * Mar 1945: Destroyed by air raids. * Jan 1946: Under [[United States|American]] rule. * Apr 1, 1951: [[Ryukyu Government]] Sanatorium Miyako Nanseien. * May 15, 1972: National Sanatorium Miyako Nanseien. * Apr 1996: The 1953 Leprosy Prevention Law was abolished. * Jul 1998: The trial for compensation started. * May 11, 2001: The trial for compensation ruled that the previous Leprosy Prevention was unconstitutional. * May 25, 2001: The trial for compensation was confirmed. The compensation of 8,000,000 [[yen]] to 14,000,000 yen was given to patients depending on the duration of unconstitutional periods.
===Number of in-patients=== * The number of in-patients is the sum of patients which changed not only by the newly diagnosed hospitalized and those who died among in-patients, by other factors such as the number of patients who escaped or were discharged, depending on the condition of the times. Recently they were encouraged to be discharged, but the long period of the segregation policy causing leprosy stigma might influence the number of those who went into the society. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Population<ref name=Fukken>Fukken Eno Jitsugetsu (2001) Zenkoku Hansenbyouryouyousho Nyuushosha Kyougikai, Koyo Shuppansha, Tokyo, Eno Jitsugetsu (2001) Zenkoku Hansenbyouryouyousho Nyuushosha Kyougikai, Koyo Shuppansha, Tokyo, p37 Jitsugetsu (2001) Zenkoku Hansenbyouryouyousho Nyuushosha Kyougikai, Koyo Shuppansha, Tokyo, p374</ref> |- | 1945 | 139 |- | 1950 | 337 |- | 1955 | 297 |- | 1960 | 347 |- | 1965 | 274 |- | 1970 | 235 |- | 1975 | 241 |- | 1980 | 273 |- | 1985 | 253 |- | 1990 | 211 |- |1999 | 184 |}
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Population<ref>http://www.eonet.ne.jp/~libell/4ryouyousyo.html2009.12.25</ref> |- | 2003 | 131 |- | 2004 | 126 |- | 2005 | 117 |- | 2006 | 107 |- | 2007 | 98 |- | 2008 | 92 |}
==Miyako Nanseien and war== * Oct 10, 1944:The first air attack at [[Miyakojima]]. * Mar 26, 1945: The second raid, and 1 patient was killed, and 4 or 5 wounded, who later died. Patients began to live in caves or other places. * April 3, 1945: the sanatorium was completely destroyed. * Aug 1945: the end of [[World War II]]. * Sept 1945: Patients knew the end of war. * In 1945, a total of 110 patients died, mostly of [[malaria]] and [[malnutrition]].
==Nusudogama (Pirates' cave)== * This is a [[stalactite]] cave situated in the middle of a cliff some hundred meters from the sanatorium. Genroku Shimoji went to the cave escaping the air raids with several people. He was born in 1924.<ref>Testimonies concerning Hansen's disease, Miyako Nanseien-hen, 2007, p240</ref> ** "There was a big air raid. Airplanes attacked with machine-guns. I went to the [[Nusudogama]], with a child and an old man. Every day people died, and the child and the old man, who was a principal of a school, died. It was an awful task to bring his body to the sanatorium. I got malaria, but I was lucky since I was young. In September, I went out of the cave. All buildings had been burned down and we made small hatches with Adan trees. We planted vegetables and [[tapioca]]. Later, American soldiers presented food and clothes (Licensed agencies for relief in Asia)."
==References== * Okinawa Prefecture Testimony Collections, Miyako-Nanseien-hen, (2007), in Japanese * The 50th year memorial book (1981), Miyako-Nanseien, Miyako-Nanseien, Jichikai. in Japanese * The 70th year anniversary book (2001), Miyako-Nanseien, Miyako-Nanseien-Jichikai. in Japanese
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.hosp.go.jp/~miyako/ Miyako Nanseien Sanatorium] in Japanese * [http://www.nanseien.com/ Miyako Nanseien Hp] in Japanese
{{coord|24|51|28|N|125|18|15|E|display=title|region:JP_type:landmark}}
